data.name: XWindow
desc: specifies the basic operations for a window component.

A window is a rectangular region on an output device with its own position, size, and internal coordinate system. A window is used for displaying data. In addition, the window receives events from the user.

methods.name: addFocusListener
desc: adds a focus listener to the object.

methods.name: addKeyListener
desc: adds a key listener to the object.

methods.name: addMouseListener
desc: adds a mouse listener to the object.

methods.name: addMouseMotionListener
desc: adds a mouse motion listener to the object.

methods.name: addPaintListener
desc: adds a paint listener to the object.

methods.name: addWindowListener
desc: adds a window listener to the object.

methods.name: getPosSize
desc: returns the outer bounds of the window.

methods.name: removeFocusListener
desc: removes the specified focus listener from the listener list.

methods.name: removeKeyListener
desc: removes the specified key listener from the listener list.

methods.name: removeMouseListener
desc: removes the specified mouse listener from the listener list.

methods.name: removeMouseMotionListener
desc: removes the specified mouse motion listener from the listener list.

methods.name: removePaintListener
desc: removes the specified paint listener from the listener list.

methods.name: removeWindowListener
desc: removes the specified window listener from the listener list.

methods.name: setEnable
desc: enables or disables the window depending on the parameter.

methods.name: setFocus
desc: sets the focus to the window.

methods.name: setPosSize
desc: sets the outer bounds of the window.

methods.name: setVisible
desc: shows or hides the window depending on the parameter.
